result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leah M Reynolds

records.addlTxt: Body only - Wisconsin & adjacent States

8:27 AM   Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Leah M Reynolds.  Attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Leah M Reynolds not in court. Court relates.  State relates regarding failure to appear. Attorney Rockow relates regarding JT in another case. Warrant remains in place until DE is picked up on it. At that time, bond will be addressed.

10:34 AM Defendant Leah M Reynolds not in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Leah M Reynolds.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court relates on non-appearance of Defendant today and that the Jury Trial is set for tomorrow. Attorney Rockow relates.  State requests warrant.  Court relates the Jury Trial is to be left on the calendar, the Jury is to be called in as Defendant wanted a trial, sees it may be a delay tactic and costs will be assessed.  Attorney Rockow relates he is not prepared to go forward due to limited contact with the Defendant, and asks that the Jury not be called in.  Court relates they will still keep the trial on the calendar and the Jury will be called in.  Court orders Bench Warrant Body Only Wisconsin and Adjacent States.

10:02 AM Defendant Leah M Reynolds in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Leah M Reynolds.  Attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Rockow relates the matter is not resolved.  Court relates trial will go forward.  Attorney Rockow relates.  State relates.  No address or phone number changes.  Bond continues.  

10:37 a.m. Case recalled.  Attorney Rockow relates the matter is now resolved.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.  Defendant now relates they want more time and won't give a plea today.  Jury Trial to remain on the calendar for next week.  Court will allow plea date up until 09/06/2022.  Court sets FPT for 10:00 a.m. on 09/06/2022 and gives Plea Questionnaire back to Attorney Rockow.
Defendant's
State's Motion in Limine (CD/DVD Recording)
State's
State's
Final pre-trial on August 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial on September 7, 2022 at 08:00 am.

2:15 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Leah M Reynolds appeared by video.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Leah M Reynolds. 
Attorney Rockow relates on transportation issues for Defendant and why she's appearing by video.  No speedy trial demand.  Jury Trial set for 09/07/2022 @ 8:00 a.m.  Proposed Jury Instructions, Witness Lists, Verdict Forms, any Motions and Notice of Intent to Use Video are to be filed by 08/30/2022.  FPT set and must appear in person for both hearings.  Address and phone number confirmed.  Bond continues.
Final pre-trial scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Leah M Reynolds
Current: 317 Corbett Ave E, Ladysmith, WI 54848 United States  (Effective: 04-27-2022)
Prior: 317 Corbett Ave E, Ladysmith, WI 54848 United States

12:27 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Leah M Reynolds not in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Leah M Reynolds. 
Attorney Rockow relates and notes the defendant was on zoom at one point briefly. Message was given about transportation issues. Request to track with 21CM228 by Defense. State requests the court reset the court hearing for an in person appearance. Court relates of no valid mailing address for the defendant. Attorney Rockow provides address update. Attorney Rockow stands mute on the phone number. 
State relates. 

State requests bench warrant - body only - WI and adjacent states. Court orders same.


2:11 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Leah M Reynolds in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Leah M Reynolds. 


Case recalled. Warrant quashed. Arraignment will proceed today in 22CF15. Formal reading of information waived. Not guilty pleas entered. 
Status hearing set. Set 5/18/22 at 1:30 PM for a plea hearing. Must appear in person.  

Address and phone number updated and to be updated in all files. Defendant to be fingerprinted at the next hearing.

ADDRESS INFO for Leah M Reynolds
Current: 317 Corbett Ave E, Ladysmith, WI 54848 United States  (Effective: 02-01-2022)
Prior: 1111 Heart Island Parkway, Rice Lake, WI 54868 United States
Return to Sender;  Not deliverable as addressed;  Unable to Forward. NOH 4/15/22
Arraignment on April 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:04 PM Defendant Leah M Reynolds appeared by Zoom video, Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared in court for Leah M Reynolds, Defendant Martin J. Applebee appears by Zoom video.  Attorney John Michael O'Boyle appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
COVER 22CF15 and 22CF14.

22CF14 - Other in court activity - Court relates Mr. Applebee qualifies, but counsel has not been appointed yet.  Attorney Rockow relates.  Court resets AIA for 02/22/22 at 11:30 a.m. and Defendant can appear by Zoom video. Address and phone number provided. Bond continues.

22CF15 - Preliminary Hearing - 3:06 p.m. Deputy Jon Fick with the Barron County Sheriffs Dept called and sworn. Direct by State.  No cross by Attorney Rockow.  State moves for bindover.  Court relates, finds probable cause, and binds over for trial. Arraignment date set and must appear in person.  Attorney Rockow relates on bond modification to allow contact with co-Defendant. State objects.  Court relates and denies bond modification.
Arraignment scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Dustin Rockow
Return to Sender;  Not deliverable as addressed;  Unable to Forward. NOH 2/1/22
Preliminary hearing on February 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

Must have no contact with Co-Defendant M.A.
Must maintain absolute sobriety.
Must not possess or consume any controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.

01:15 PM Defendant Leah M Reynolds in court by Zoom video with attorney Andrew T Knaak by Zoom video for today only.  Defendant Leah M Reynolds in custody.  Brian H. Wright appeared for the State of Wisconsin in court.
Qualifies for public defender and Attorney Dustin Rockow will be representing.  Address updated by Defendant, but states her dob is incorrect on the complaint.  Defendant will not provide the court with a dob so Court relates the dob on record will remain for now. Formal reading of complaint waived.  State requests cash bond.  1:23 p.m. Defendant and Attorney Knaak put in a breakout rooom to discuss bond.  1:27 p.m. Case recalled and bond discussed.  Signature bond set with conditions.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
